troubleshooting.title: Starting Motor Fails to Operate
troubleshooting.shortdesc: When the starting motor does not operate after pushing the button, inspect connections, wiring, and battery charge level.

condition.p: Starting motor does not operate when start button is pushed.

cause.p: The issue may be due to loose connections, damaged wiring, or a weak battery.
cause.note: If hydrometer reading is less than 1.225, the problem is likely due to a weak or discharged battery.

step.cmd: Inspect all terminal connections for tightness:
Examine wiring for breaks in insulation that could cause short circuits
If connections and wiring are functioning properly, test battery with hydrometer
